meanings.sent1: She held strong antilabor beliefs and refused to take on any job.
meanings.sent2: The antilabor policies of the company led to a decrease in employee morale.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed its antilabor attitude by lazily napping all day.
meanings.sent4: His antilabor stance was like a wall blocking any discussion about overtime.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds symbolized the antilabor storm approaching the peaceful village.

meanings.definition: A person or group that is against labor or work.
meanings.sent1: The antilabor at the protest carried signs advocating for shorter work hours.
meanings.sent2: The union leader accused the government of being infiltrated by antilabor forces.
meanings.sent3: The antilabor group's mascot was a sloth wearing a 'No Work' t-shirt.
meanings.sent4: She saw the antilabor as a threat to the progress of the labor movement.
meanings.sent5: The antilabor's speeches were like a call to arms for those seeking to avoid work.
